plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small, early-blooming bulbous plant often among the first signs of spring in temperate regions. It produces cup-shaped flowers that emerge even through late winter snow.
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers are one of the earliest bloomers and their emergence marks the unofficial start of spring in many cultures.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A hardy perennial that blooms in winter and early spring with large white flowers often tinged with pink. It is commonly found in gardens as well as wild in mountainous areas.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a rose but a member of the buttercup family (Ranunculaceae).

plants.name: Michelia champaca
plants.description: A tropical tree producing highly fragrant orange-yellow flowers that bloom year-round, peaking in late winter and early spring in many regions.
plants.funFact: The Champak flower is prized in perfumery and traditional ceremonies for its intense fragrance.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its bright, fluffy yellow flower clusters, often blooming in late winter to early spring in Mediterranean climates.
plants.funFact: Silver Wattle blooms provide an important source of nectar for bees during the late winter when few other flowers are available.
